text:
when creating a selector, a ";" semicolon slipped in (programmers see them often
at an end-of-line).

even when doing "ant myTarget -debug", the text is not cited.

BUILD FAILED

hauser@acm.org
text:
it is a convenience issue, just append ":\"" + textFound +"\"" to the message
provided

creator: mbenson@apache.org
text: that answer still doesn't make sense.  :(

creator: mbenson@apache.org
text:
Are you requesting that if spurious text is added and it is found that the
task/type doesn't accept nested text, the error message should include the text
found to make it easier for the user to find the offending text?

creator: hauser@acm.org
text:
right.

If may be advisable to test the length of the spurious text and if it is e.g.
longer than 20, take the first8 + "[...]+ ending8
fixed as suggested in SVN HEAD.
creator: mbenson@apache.org
